This sample document demonstrates the use of some of the XML DocBook markup and formatting. The document content is for illustrative purposes only. Its accuracy is not guaranteed. Introduction Welcome to the world of modern transportation. In this document, five popular modes of transport are discussed. They are: Cruise Ship Moon Rover Satellite Train Bulldozer These modes of transportation represent water, space, virtual transport, ground and construction. These are popular modes in today's world, aside from the obvious choices such as automobile or airliner. The ever-changing world of transportation is constantly providing us with new options for moving from place to place. Water — The Cruise Ship Cruise Shipswater transportationCruise ships are fast becoming a popular way for people to travel the world's waterways. Towering over the Caribbean, the Titanic II measures 73,941 tons (75,124 metric tons). Lodging more than 2,000 passengers requires in excess of a thousand staterooms spanning 14 decks. The Titanic II is set to sail in February, 2002. Its builders and designers have virtually guaranteed the ship to be unsinkable. Titanic IIThe Titanic II's lavish buffets are fun to look at even if you're too full to eat. A themed menu is offered each night, including Italian, Mexican, and Caribbean island fare. The dining rooms are also theme-based, featuring rooms such as the Broadway lounge and a Roaring 20's nightclub. Some of Titanic II's destinations include:Titanic II's Destinations Antigua AntiguaQuietly sophisticated former British colony; long powdery beaches, fashionable resorts, lots of tennis. Yachting favorite for its fingered coast, consistent winds. Extraordinary ruins of the British Navy from the 18th and 19th centuries. Small to midsize resorts; some all-inclusive. St. Barts St. BartsTiny French Eden of sophisticated and very expensive restaurants, shops, and outdoor cafés. Ringed by beautiful beaches and great snorkeling. Islanders of Norman, Breton descent. Small hotels. Martinique MartiniqueFrench and Caribbean. Bold scenery and sophisticated living. Exotic flowers, mountains, and rain forest trails share the island with marinas, golf, bistros, casino, and discos. Historic sugarcane plantations and museums. French and creole cuisine. Tourist centers crowded with Europeans. Popular cruise port. Small to midsize resorts. Montserrat MontserratQuiet British colony with Irish influence. North American, British expatriate community. Hiking to waterfalls and volcanic peak. Gray and gold beaches. Small resorts. Saba SabaTiny Dutch island jutting 3,000 feet (4,827 meters) above sea. Lilliputian villages of gingerbread houses. Hiking trails, diving in new marine park. No beaches. Culebra and Vieques Culebra and ViequesLow, dry, quiet islands off Puerto Rico's east coast. Gorgeous beaches. Vieques has Spanish fort, U.S. Navy facilities, bioluminescent bay, and camping. Culebra National Wildlife Refuge has 86 bird species; hundreds of terns in spring.
Employee information — for internal use only This section includes information for employees only and is not intended for publication for the general public. ATTENTION If you are among the employees sailing on the test launch of Titanic II, here is a list of tools you should carry in your luggage, as last-minute repairs may be necessary before carrying passengers. Tools Necessary for Minor Repairs Aboard Titanic II KB10113 Screwdriver KB10119 Saw KB20334 Hammer KB40988 Staple Gun KB10001 Duct Tape KB10002 WD-40 Space — The Moon Rover moon roverspace The moon rover is a relatively new entry in the transportation realm. Since journeys to the historic Apollo 11 site have become popular, there is considerably more interest in the moon rover as a means of transport. Although some have questioned leaving tire tracks near mankind's first footsteps on the Moon, the newest moon rover models do not disturb the area. Moon rovers deliver more than just a celestial travelogue. Interactive space exploration is also available. Using robotic sensors to explore the Moon, visitors to Mission Control modules enjoy the latest in virtual reality rides. Visitors ride on a slow-motion virtual roller-coaster ride over lunar hills and craters - seeing, feeling and hearing everything the sensors encounter. Currently, Moon Rover America® is negotiating with several established theme parks for US theme park rights. The company is also meeting with media firms who want to beam video from the rover's moving eye to a mass audience via the Internet. Important Note! Riding in a moon rover can be dangerous to small children and those with heart conditions. Consult your physician before undertaking any moon rover excursion. Virtual — The Satellite Virtual transportation SatelliteAs more and more corporations take advantage of the satellite revolution, video conferencing is becoming increasingly popular. It provides a cost-effective alternative to travel time and cost. By broadcasting meetings to worldwide offices each month, companies save considerable time and money by using this method of communication. What is a satellite? It is a man-made object launched into orbit to relay voice, data and video signals as part of a telecommunications network. Signals are transmitted to the satellite from earth station antennas, amplified and reflected back to earth for reception by other earth station antennas. Satellites are capable of linking two or more points on earth together with other multiple points on earth. These satellites are located in a geosynchronous orbit approximately 22,300 miles in space over the equator. Reasons for using this superior technology include: Savings in travel time and overall cost. Ease of scheduling and availability. Worldwide communication is easily accomplished. Ground — The Train Ground Transportation TrainAs improvements are made in the railway industry, rail travel has gained popularity as a reasonably fast, inexpensive means of travel. It is popular among business and vacation travelers alike. With summer around the corner, many travel promotions are available for the perfect summer getaway. Not only are vacations via rail a great value, but families can sit back and enjoy the scenery, walk about the train, watch movies and enjoy other on-board entertainment on long-distance trains, while effortlessly bypassing the inconveniences of crowded airports and congested highways. Train types include:types of trains Superliners: These are bi-level cars having four types of first-class sleeping accommodations. They include: the Deluxe Bedroom for two passengers; the Standard Bedroom for two; the Family Bedroom for two adults and two small children; and the Accessible Bedroom for special mobility requirements. Business Class: Business Class seating is reserved. The coaches have two comfortable reclining seats on each side of the aisle and fold-out tray tables. All seats feature increased distance between seats, individual reading lights and overhead luggage racks. Relax while enjoying complimentary coffee, tea, juice or soda and a newspaper. Changing rooms and restrooms are available at one end of the car. Seating for passengers in a wheelchair is available. Metropolitan: Metropolitan First Class offers an extra-wide, reclining reserved seat in a separate section of the train; at-seat service, complimentary beverages, meals and newspaper. Construction — The Bulldozer ConstructionBulldozer During prosperous economic times, the bulldozer is a popular method of construction transportation in the building industry. Useful and utilitarian, the bulldozer can accomplish any number of goals in a construction project, from simple movement of earth to destruction of existing structures. Bulldozers are typically used for the following types of construction activities: Excavation Grading Landscaping Wrecking and demolition Bulldozers vary in size from the light-duty variety to the heavy-duty type. When a building “boom” is in progress, it is unusual to see a bulldozer inactive.
